result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:04 AM; Case called for Hearing. Prosecuting attorney Alyssa M. Schaller in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Billy B Allen in court.  Attorney Jessica A Klein in court for Billy B Allen.  Atty. Klein provides an update; she notes the defendant is working in getting into some AODA treatment.  Atty. Klein requests a further proceedings date in about 45-60 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on September 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Adjourn request filed by Atty Klein. **Reviewed by Judge Reillly - Approved**
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Hearing on August 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:39 AM Defendant Billy B Allen in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty. Klein has just received discovery and pretrial offer and asks for another status date.  Hearing scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Hearing on July 6, 2022 at 10:30 am.

records.addlTxt: of Judge Bohren, filed by Attorney Klein.   **Reviewed by Judge Bohren on June 13, 2022 - APPROVED.**
Defendant waives his right to a Preliminary Hearing.

08:24 AM Defendant Billy B Allen in court with attorney Jessica A Klein.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendant's waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Once this case has been reassigned the parties will receive notice of the next date.

records.addlTxt:
01:56 PM Defendant Billy B Allen in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The Court goes over the procedural history of the case.
Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation.  
Defendant requests the court appoint counsel.  Court swears defendant.  Court grants request, repayment at the rate of $125.00 per month commencing June 15, 2022.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Defendant to have no contact with victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key.  Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.  Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms.  Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.

02:48 PM Defendant Billy B Allen in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern as a friend of the court.   Andrew Nesheim appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant is not eligible for State Public Defender representation. The Defendant given the Petition for Court Appointed Counsel paperwork in court.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
